item.title: JAXA deploys first ever wooden satellite in space from ISS - WION
item.description:
JAXA Deploys First Ever Wooden Satellite in Space from ISS

Publication Date: January 9, 2025 Source: Wion

LignoSat, the world’s first wooden satellite, launched into orbit last month to explore the potential of wood in space applications.

  • LignoSat was delivered to the International Space Station aboard a SpaceX Dragon cargo capsule in November 2024.
  • The satellite is made from honoki magnolia wood and uses a traditional Japanese wood-joining technique.
  • Over its six-month mission, it will assess wood's performance versus traditional materials like aluminum and titanium.
  • LignoSat will monitor the effects of extreme temperatures and radiation in space.
  • The project aims to inform future designs for habitats on the Moon or Mars using sustainable materials.
  • It also aims to reduce space debris impact by ensuring complete combustion upon re-entry.
“With timber, a material we can produce ourselves, we could build habitats and work in space indefinitely,” said Takao Doi, an astronaut and researcher.

This innovative project marks a significant step towards utilizing sustainable materials in space exploration.

item.title: 'Intensely Fake': NASA astronaut's recent aurora video from space sparks authenticity debate online - Moneycontrol
item.description:
'Intensely Fake': NASA Astronaut's Recent Aurora Video Sparks Authenticity Debate Online

Date: January 09, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

NASA astronaut Don Pettit has shared a mesmerizing video showcasing vibrant green auroras seen from the International Space Station (ISS). The clip, shared on January 6 via X, left viewers in awe and sparked debates about its authenticity.

  • The nine-second video highlights the green glow of auroras created by charged particles from the Sun interacting with Earth’s magnetic field.
  • Pettit captioned the post, “Flying over aurora; intensely green.”
  • Social media reacted with a mix of admiration and skepticism regarding the authenticity of the video.
“Flying over aurora; intensely green.” - Don Pettit (@astro_Pettit)

Comments ranged from awe to disbelief, with one viewer exclaiming, “Oh my goodness, wow!” while another questioned its effect on equipment.

“Oh my goodness wow” - Jack Beyer (@thejackbeyer)

The video continues to captivate and divide audiences online.

item.title: Steve Smith to lead Australia in Sri Lanka - Cricbuzz
item.description:
Steve Smith to Lead Australia in Sri Lanka

Publication Date: Thu, Jan 9, 2025
Source: Cricbuzz

Steve Smith has been appointed as the captain of the Australian cricket team for their upcoming tour of Sri Lanka, as Pat Cummins is on paternity leave and recovering from an ankle injury.

  • Pat Cummins is unavailable due to paternity leave and an ankle issue.
  • Josh Hazlewood is sidelined with an injury.
  • Mitchell Marsh has been dropped from the team.
  • The squad includes three frontline pacers: Mitchell Starc, Scott Boland, and Sean Abbott.
  • Nathan McSweeney and Cooper Connolly have earned spots in the 16-man squad for the two-Test series.
  • The series will take place in Galle, Sri Lanka.
"Sri Lanka is a challenging and exciting place to tour given the different conditions players may be presented with..." - George Bailey, Chief Selector

This series marks Australia’s last Test assignment before the World Test Championship final in June.

item.title: TCS Q3 Results LIVE: Tata Consultancy Services to report earnings today, shares rise - Upstox
item.description:
TCS Q3 Results LIVE

Date: January 9, 2025

Source: Tata Consultancy Services

Shares of TCS were trading at ₹4,126, reflecting a gain of 0.44%, on the NSE. The latest October-December quarter results will be announced post market hours.

  • Market capitalisation stands at ₹14,96,169.64 crore.
  • Shares rose by 0.65% to ₹4,135.25 apiece.
  • Analysts predict flat revenue between ₹64,150 to ₹64,250 crore due to higher furloughs.
  • Potential net profit growth of 3%-4% to between ₹12,280 and ₹12,350 crore is expected.
The company has informed the Exchange about a Board Meeting to consider quarterly results and dividend.

Overall, anticipation around TCS's earnings report continues to create positive market sentiment.

item.title: Pravasi Bharatiya Divas LIVE: India will fulfill world’s demand for skilled talent, says PM Modi - The Hindu
item.description:
Pravasi Bharatiya Divas LIVE: India will fulfill world’s demand for skilled talent, says PM Modi

Date: January 09, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the 18th Pravasi Bharatiya Divas convention, celebrating the contributions of the Indian diaspora to their homeland, with a focus on the theme “Diaspora’s contribution to a Viksit Bharat”.

  • Event held from January 8 to January 10, organized by the Ministry of External Affairs and Odisha government.
  • External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar emphasized the role of the diaspora in contributing to a developed India.
  • Prime Minister Modi asserted that India is a hub for skilled talent, willing to fulfill global demands.
  • Significant statements from global leaders recognizing India's contributions to global civilization.
“India will fulfill the world’s demand for skilled talent” - PM Modi

This event underscores India's aim to highlight the contributions of its diaspora to global development and promote skilled Indian youth abroad.

item.title: Pravasi Bharathi Divas LIVE: PM Modi to inaugurate the 18th Pravasi Bharatiya Divas convention - The Hindu
item.description:
Pravasi Bharatiya Divas LIVE: India will fulfill world’s demand for skilled talent, says PM Modi

Date & Source: January 09, 2025 - The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the 18th Pravasi Bharatiya Divas convention in Bhubaneswar, Odisha, emphasizing the contributions of the Indian diaspora towards a developed India.

  • The convention runs from January 8 to January 10, 2025.
  • This year's theme is “Diaspora’s contribution to a Viksit Bharat”.
  • External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar highlighted the importance of the young Indian diaspora.
  • India aims to equip its youth with skills to meet international demand.
  • PM Modi flagged off the Pravasi Bharatiya Express, a special train for the diaspora.
PM Modi: “Whenever Indian youths go abroad, they go with skills.”

This event marks a significant celebration of the Indian community abroad and aims to strengthen ties with the diaspora.

item.title: Tirupati stampede: President Murmu, PM Modi condole death of devotees - The Hindu
item.description:
Tirupati Stampede Tragedy: President and PM Express Condolences

Date: January 09, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

A stampede at the Lord Venkateswara Swamy temple in Tirupati resulted in the deaths of at least six devotees and injuries to dozens more as they jostled for tickets during the Vaikunta Dwara Darshanam.

  • At least six devotees lost their lives in the incident.
  • Dozens were injured and are currently being treated.
  • President Droupadi Murmu expressed her condolences and sympathy for the bereaved and prayed for the injured's recovery.
  • Prime Minister Narendra Modi also offered condolences and stated that the AP Government is providing assistance to those affected.
"Distressed to know that a stampede in Tirupati led to loss of life of many devotees. I extend my heartfelt condolences to the bereaved families and pray for speedy recovery of the injured." - President Droupadi Murmu
"Pained by the stampede in Tirupati, Andhra Pradesh. My thoughts are with those who have lost their near and dear ones. I pray that the injured recover soon." - PM Narendra Modi

This tragic event highlights the need for better crowd management and safety measures during large gatherings at places of worship.

item.title: Manappuram Finance surges over 5% as RBI lifts curbs on subsidiary Asirvad Micro Finance; all you need to know - Upstox
item.description:
Manappuram Finance Shares Rise 6% After RBI Lifts Restrictions on Asirvad Micro Finance

Date: January 9, 2024
Source: Upstox

Manappuram Finance's share price increased significantly following the Reserve Bank of India's decision to lift supervisory restrictions on its subsidiary Asirvad Micro Finance.

  • Manappuram Finance shares surged by 6.4%, reaching ₹191.50 on the NSE.
  • The RBI lifted restrictions citing compliance with regulatory guidelines by Asirvad Micro Finance and DMI Finance.
  • In October 2024, the RBI had imposed restrictions due to concerns over excessive loan pricing.
  • The removal of restrictions is based on the companies' improved compliance and commitment to fair loan pricing.
  • Manappuram reported a 2% increase in consolidated net profit for Q2 FY25, totaling ₹571 crore.
“Now, having satisfied itself based on companies’ submissions... the Reserve Bank has decided to lift the aforementioned restrictions.”

The lifting of the supervisory curbs is expected to provide a boost to Manappuram Finance's operations and investor confidence.

item.title: Pakistan Cricket Board Responds After Report Says Champions Trophy May Move Out Of Pakistan Due To T.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Pakistan Cricket Board Responds After Report Says Champions Trophy May Move Out Of Pakistan Due To This Reason

Publication Date: December 20, 2024

Source: NDTV

The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has relocated the ODI tri-series from Multan to Karachi and Lahore, addressing concerns over venue readiness for the Champions Trophy. The renovation work at key stadiums is reportedly on track, despite social media reports of delays.

  • The ODI tri-series involves Pakistan, South Africa, and New Zealand.
  • The Champions Trophy is set to begin on February 19 in Karachi.
  • PCB emphasizes confidence in the upgraded venues for hosting international matches.
  • Concerns remain about the completion of renovation work at several stadiums.
  • Upgrades at Gaddafi Stadium have increased its capacity to 35,000.
  • New LED lights have been installed to improve broadcast quality.
“It’s a no-brainer on what would happen if PCB misses deadlines and venues don't meet ICC checklist. Tournament can't be played at semi-ready venues.”

The PCB collaborates with the ICC to ensure all venues meet the required standards ahead of the tournament, stressing the importance of timely completion of all preparations.

item.title: No one has to worry, says Maharashtra Health Minister Abitkar on HMPV - Business Standard
item.description:
Maharashtra Health Minister Assures Public About HMPV Concerns

Publication Date: Recent

Source: Business Standard

Maharashtra Health Minister Prakash Abitkar has reassured the public that there is no cause for alarm regarding the Human metapneumovirus (HMPV), stating that the health department is effectively managing the situation.

  • Minister Abitkar described the current variant of HMPV as not strong, drawing parallels to past health crises like the COVID-19 pandemic.
  • Five cases of HMPV have been reported in India, with specific cases located in Bengaluru, Ahmedabad, and Nagpur.
  • WHO official Margaret Harris noted that the rise in respiratory infections during winter and spring is typical and manageable.
  • Federal Health Minister JP Nadda also emphasized that there is no cause for alarm and that health systems are well-prepared.
“No one has to worry...” - Prakash Abitkar, Maharashtra Health Minister

The government is monitoring the situation closely, ensuring that health surveillance networks are on alert for any potential challenges posed by HMPV.
